revised_title: Lamb Shift Calculation for Tightly Bound Electrons in Heavy Atoms
tldr: The authors present a method for calculating the Lamb shift of a tightly bound electron in heavy atoms using an expansion in the coupling of the electron with the radiation field. The method is applicable to electrons in heavy atoms and is designed for the case of large atomic numbers. The authors demonstrate the practicality of this method by calculating the Lamb shift of a 2s-electron in mercury and discuss the potential for checking quantum mechanical techniques in strong fields.
